title: Common commands
content:
Redis common commands # Database # DBSIZE # DBSIZE Return the number of keys in the currently-selected database. see also https://redis.io/commands/dbsize/
FLUSHALL # FLUSHALL [ASYNC | SYNC] Remove all keys from all database. see also https://redis.io/commands/flushall/
FLUSHDB # FLUSHDB [ASYNC | SYNC] Remove all keys from the current database. see also https://redis.io/commands/flushdb/
SELECT # SELECT index Change the selected database for the current connection. see also https://redis.io/commands/select/
KEY # KEYS # KEYS pattern Returns all keys matching pattern. See also https://redis.io/commands/keys/
EXISTS # EXISTS key [key ...] Determine if a key exists. See also https://redis.io/commands/exists/
EXPIRE # EXPIRE key seconds [NX | XX | GT | LT] Set a key’s time to live in seconds. See also https://redis.io/commands/expire/
TTL # TTL key Get the time to live for a key in seconds. See also https://redis.io/commands/ttl/
TYPE # TYPE key Determine the type stored at key. See also https://redis.io/commands/type/
STRLEN # STRLEN key Get the length of the value stored in a key. See also https://redis.io/commands/strlen/
VALUE # GET # GET key Get the value of a key. See also https://redis.io/commands/get/
APPEND # APPEND key value Append a value to a key. See also https://redis.io/commands/append/
INCR # INCR key Increment the integer value of a key by one. See also https://redis.io/commands/incr/
SET # SET key value [NX | XX] [GET] [EX seconds | PX milliseconds | EXAT unix-time-seconds | PXAT unix-time-milliseconds | KEEPTTL] Set the string value of a key. See also https://redis.io/commands/set/
